description: From Medieval Latin praeēmptiō (“previous purchase”), from praeemō (“buy before”), from Latin prae- (“before”) + emō (“buy”).

definitionGroups.group: An act or process that preempts; a preventive or forestalling action; as:

entries.meaning: The purchase of something before it is offered for sale to others.
The purchase of public land by the occupant.
(computing) The temporary interruption of a task without its cooperation and with the intention of resuming it at a later time.
(law) The displacement of a lower jurisdiction's laws when they conflict with those of a higher jurisdiction.
